result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher L Pontillo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher L Pontillo is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher L Pontillo was found guilty of Manufacture/Deliver THC (>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Credit for 2 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: BOND APPLIED - fine pd in full.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.
*  Pay fine of $300.00 and court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Probation may be transferred to Illinois.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Tracey Braun appeared for the State. DE appears with Atty Frank Parise.   Clerk P. Scypta.   
MINUTES:  211 - Recommendations made.   Court orders withheld sentence; defendant placed on probation for 2years w/conditions.  2 days sentence credit if revoked. Court orders a $300 fine plus costs, due in 30 days or civil judgment.   DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay $250 DNA surcharge and notice is given. Appeal rights given.  (ps 12/14/15)
Acknowledgment of Plea Offer/Agreement

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  9:16am-  Matter is resolved.  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court.  On the motion of the State, counts 2-4 are dismissed.  Presentence Investigation ordered.  10/26/2015 JT removed from the court's calendar.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 23, 2015 at 02:00 pm.  Bond continued.

Parties agree to reschedule 8/17/2015 Jury trial.  Some of the state's witnesses are unavailable (officers) due to mandatory training.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 9/16/2015 at 8:30am & Jury trial scheduled from October 26, 2015 at 9am.  Parties notified in court.
filed by ADA Jason Zapf
filed by ADA, Jason Zapf  kmk
State's List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery -filed by ADA, Jason Zapf  kmk

Attorney Jason Zapf appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Frank Parise.  Clerk: MHerr.
MINUTES:  10:27am- Warrant has been unsealed & it did not contain the information the DE was looking for.  Attorney Parise is requesting matter be set for trial.  Court sets matter for trial.  Court orders all witness lists & motions in limine be filed by 7/10/2015.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Bond continued.
to Unseal Warrant - IT IS ORDERED that the warrant in file # 14-CF-1403 (KDOG #14-170124) is hereby ordered unsealed.

Defendant, Christopher L Pontillo, appeared with Attorney Frank J. Parise.  Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: DE's motion to compel disclosure and to unseal the search warrant. ST does not object to unsealing the search warrant. The Court orders the warrant unsealed, matter adjourned to allow Atty Parise to review, he may file an additional motion if the matter needs to be heard.  Motion hearing scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 10:30 am.
in Support of DE's Motion to Compel
DE's Motion to Compel Disclosure of Confidential Information & Unseal Warrant - filed by Atty Parise
Today's hearing removed from the calendar Atty the request of Atty Parise; Motion Hearing set.

122 p.m.  Attorney James Kraus appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney F Parise.  Clk LE  Referred to Br 7 for further dispo on 2/19/15 @ 830 a.m.  - FPT.  Info filed- not guilty plea entered.  Bond - continued posted.
Further proceedings on February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
